item.description: Mt Tom is a great hike, not too high but lots of great views. Most of the hike you follow a ridge line so you are able to look into the Connecticut River Valley, overlooking farms and small towns. Many times I have seen gliders or hawks take advantage of the natural thermals. Mt Tom is also a "lost ski area" so I it loosely follows our summer theme of hiking ski area mountains. We will meet inside the main entrance at the parking lot for lake Bray. total distance will be about 6 miles and will be at a moderate pace. Although this hike is in Western MA it is easy to get to, simple trip down Mass Pike (rt 90). For full directions check out: http://www.mass.gov/d... Total time from Boston is just about 2 hours and 15min. Please bring water, snack, decent hiking shoes. weather (as of today) looks great on sunday, sunny and not too hot.
item.name: Hike Mt Tom
